title: PTOKHEIA
content:
PTOKHEIA (Ptocheia) was the personified spirit (daimona) of beggary. She was a companion of Penia (Poverty) and Amekhania (Want) and her opposite
        number were Ploutos (Wealth) and Euthenia
        (Prosperity).

Aristophanes, Plutus 549 ff (trans. O'Neill) (Greek comedy C5th to 4th B.C.)
          :
        "Penia : It's not my life that you describe; you are attacking the existence beggars lead.
        Khremylos (Chremylus) : Is Ptokheia (Ptocheia, Beggary) not Penia's (Poverty's) sister?
        Penia : Thrasyboulos and Dionysios are one and the same according to you. No, my life is not like that and never
        will be. The beggar, whom you have depicted to us, never possesses anything."
